body_html:
Oh no...
I just recently had a case where I needed histograms of a large amount of data and found np.histogram too slow for this. Then I found this torch function which I hoped would accelerate my algorithm but now I must read that exactly this function is not implemented...

I think the priorities are definitely wrong here. On the one side, new version are released which contain breaking changes of already working stuff, but on the other side, important functionality is not implemented at all...

P.S. At least this CPU implementation is a lot faster than the np equivalent, but still GPU implementation would be nice...

body:
Oh no...
I just recently had a case where I needed histograms of a large amount of data and found np.histogram too slow for this. Then I found this torch function which I hoped would accelerate my algorithm but now I must read that exactly this function is not implemented...

I think the priorities are definitely wrong here. On the one side, new version are released which contain breaking changes of already working stuff, but on the other side, important functionality is not implemented at all...

P.S. At least this CPU implementation is a lot faster than the np equivalent, but still GPU implementation would be nice...
